page.title: 07RELIGIOUS WORSHIP LEADENHAM
page.content: The Church of St.Swithun in the Village is a fine example of an early thirteenth century Wool Church.It is large by village standards and in an excellent state of repair.Leadenham has many feudal aspects.It always has had,and still has,a squire who is also the Patron of the Church.In Leadenham he has not only appointed the Rector but down the ages encouraged the villagers to care for and support the Church.This has resulted in a well maintained and loved Church which is an integral part of the life of the community.There are certain occasions in the year when the village goes to Church.The death of a Villager,Harvest or Christmas for example sees this fine old building full of people.At other times it is like any other rural Church when the faithful attend for the worship of God.
